intro: Astragalus puniceus var. puniceus, commonly known as the red milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit, with hairy stems and trifoliate leaves that are often grayish-green in color. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Astragalus puniceus var. puniceus is often found in grasslands, disturbed sites, and along roadsides.
